New Records: Indonesia's unbeaten start in the third round of Asian qualifiers for the 2026 FIFA World Cup
Key Match Events: Ragnar Oratmangoen equalized for Indonesia in first-half stoppage time
Rafael Struick scored a sublime curling effort to give Indonesia the lead
Bahrain scored a late goal in the 99th minute to equalize
Indonesia official was shown marching orders
Pre-Game Insights: Indonesia were seen as underdogs against Bahrain, who are 53 places above them in FIFA rankings
Post-Match Reflections: Indonesia were frustrated by the late goal and additional time controversy
The match was a cause for disappointment in the Indonesia camp
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match marked Indonesia's first time in the third round of Asian qualifiers
Indonesia's next game is against a struggling China side
